answerText: Confessions of an English Opium Eater[10] Confessions of an English Opium Eater was written by this author of a critical essay involving Macduff and Lennox, titled On the Knocking at the Gate in Macbeth.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 13 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this work's introduction "To the Reader," the author quotes Wordsworth in declaring his intent "humbly to express / a penitential loneliness." For 10 points each: [10] Name this autobiographical work that dedicates separate sections to describing the "Pleasures" and the "Pains" that resulted from medicating its author's stomach aches with the title substance.
